title.rendered: Paarl vs Durban, South Africa T20 League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Paarl: Jos Buttler (wk), Jason Roy, Wihan Lubbe, David Miller (c), Dane Vilas, Eoin Morgan, Ferisco Adams, Evan Jones, Bjorn Fortuin, Lungi Ngidi, Tabraiz Shamsi

Durban: Kyle Mayers, Quinton de Kock (c & wk), Heinrich Klaasen, Wiaan Mulder, Dwaine Pretorius, Jason Holder, Keemo Paul/Akila Dananjaya, Keshav Maharaj, Hardus Viljoen, Prenelan Subrayen, Reece Topley

Pitch Report

Venue: Boland Park, Paarl

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 125

2nd innings average score: 170

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for spin

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Tabraiz Shamsi has exploited these conditions the most. In 13 games, he has fetched 19 wickets with an economy of 7 RPO.

Jos Buttler and Prenelan Subrayen are the only players from both teams to feature in the Ultimate Team in all their last 5 games.

Hardus Viljoen may not provide plenty of points, but his dual skills have been pushing him in the Ultimate Team. In his last 5 matches, he has taken 5 wickets and scored 2 20-plus scores. Given the average scores, his dual ability will be in demand.

The dip in Jason Holder’s selection percentage is for a reason. Despite bowling the most overs (10) for his team, his strike rate of 30 reads the worst for a bowler who has taken 2 or more wickets.

In the last 3 matches, spinners accounted for 52% of the wickets. Scoring runs was so difficult that there were only 4 30-plus scores.

Barring Evan Jones, no bowler from Paarl has been able to make an impact in fantasy leagues. On the other hand, while Reece Topley has been effective with the new and old ball, Prenelan Subrayen has been the wrecker-in-chief in the middle overs for Durban.
